meanings.definition: Used as a reflexive pronoun to refer to a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The team members helped each other, but they also knew how to rely on theirself.
meanings.sent2: The students worked together, but each one had to think for theirself during the exam.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone brought food for theirself, leading to a buffet of snacks.
meanings.sent4: In a choir, each voice harmonizes with theirself to create beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: The ants worked as a team, but each ant carried food for theirself back to the nest.

meanings.definition: Used as a reflexive pronoun to refer to a single person of unspecified gender.
meanings.sent1: When Sarah felt proud of her accomplishments, she congratulated theirself in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: After the long day, Alex treated theirself to a relaxing bath and a good book.
meanings.sent3: Tom accidentally bumped into a mirror and apologized to theirself, chuckling at the mistake.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet room, Mia whispered positive affirmations to theirself to boost confidence.
meanings.sent5: During the hike, Max encouraged theirself to keep going by focusing on the beautiful scenery.
